text: Lonnie McIntosh (July 18, 1941 â€“ April 21, 2016), known by his stage name, Lonnie Mack, was an American rock, blues, and country singer-guitarist. As a featured artist, his recording career lasted from 1963 to 1990. He remained active as a performer into the early 2000s. Mack is also called one of the finer "blue-eyed soul" singers of his era. See, section entitled "Blue-eyed soul ballads". Mack died of natural causes in Smithville, Tennessee on April 21, 2016, aged 74. He was buried at his hometown in Aurora, Indiana near the Ohio River. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American blues musicians Category:American rock guitarists Category:American rock singers Category:Country guitarists Category:Musicians from Indiana Category:Musicians from Tennessee Category:Singers from Indiana Category:Singers from Tennessee
title: Lonnie Mack
